xml:
Lumigan<tm tmtype="reg"/> National funding/access decisions

Scottish Medicines Consortium (SMC) Decisions

The Scottish Medicines Consortium has advised (March 2013) that bimatoprost 300 micrograms/mL preservative-free eye drops (Lumigan single-dose eye drops) are accepted for restricted use within NHS Scotland for the reduction of elevated intra-ocular pressure in chronic open-angle glaucoma and ocular hypertension (as monotherapy or as adjunctive therapy to beta-blockers) in adults who have proven sensitivity to benzalkonium chloride.
Clinical medicinal product information Clinical medicinal product information
